name: Eating for Two: How Do You Love Sardines, Tell Me All the Ways
description: I know I’m not the only person frustrated by the breathless announcements of nutrition journalism and by the studies behind it, which are so often contradictory and can always be manipulated to show just about anything (as discussed in last...
recipeIngredient: 1 3.75-ounce can sardines packed in olive oil
Triscuits or other substantial crackers (I like Woven Wheats, the Triscuit imposter sold by Whole Foods)

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the sardines. Cut them up into small flakes, like tuna salad. I know the backbones you may find look creepy, but don’t remove them: they are edible, high in calcium, and unnoticeable if you chop the fish well enough.
Stir in the mustard and mayonnaise, adding more or less according to taste. Season with freshly ground pepper and eat with crackers.
